TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {1894=German firm of publishers, founded 1826 in Regensburg by Friederich Pustet (1798–1882), specialising in liturgical books and church music. From 1868 to 1900 the firm had exclusive rights to publish hymnbooks for the Roman Catholic church, and acquired an international reputation for authoritative editions. The firm remained independent until 1978, when it was acquired by Feuchtinger and Gleichauf of Regensburg.}
textBeforeTable: Pustet's plate numbers were issued in a regular chronological fashion. Plate numbers, when used, are in the format of F.P. ####. Dates in italics are estimated. Pustet was known to issue subsequent editions of a work using the same plate number as the first edition. Plate Numbers Rome (1898) Friedrich Pustet & Co.: New York (1865) and Cincinnati (1867). Agencies Addresses Imprints Imprints, Addresses, Agencies Editions German firm of publishers, founded 1826 in Regensburg by Friederich Pustet (1798–1882), specialising in liturgical books and church music. From 1868 to 1900 the firm had exclusive rights to publish hymnbooks for the Roman Catholic church, and acquired an international reputation for authoritative editions. The firm remained independent until 1978, when it was acquired by Feuchtinger and Gleichauf of Regensburg.
